meanings.definition: A piece of glass or other transparent material with curved sides for concentrating or dispersing light rays.
meanings.sent1: I cleaned my glasses with a soft cloth to remove the smudges on the lenses.
meanings.sent2: The camera lenses captured the beautiful sunset perfectly.
meanings.sent3: When the magnifying lenses went on strike, everything looked smaller!
meanings.sent4: Her perspective on life changed as if she had put on a new pair of lenses.
meanings.sent5: The lenses in the binoculars made the distant mountains appear closer than ever before.

meanings.definition: A transparent body having two opposite curved surfaces, or one of the surfaces of such a body, commonly used in optical instruments.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully adjusted the lenses on the microscope to focus on the tiny specimen.
meanings.sent2: The telescope's lenses allowed us to see the craters on the moon clearly.
meanings.sent3: The detective mistakenly thought the suspect's glasses were special lenses for seeing through walls.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like lenses, reflecting the truth hidden beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The kaleidoscope's lenses created mesmerizing patterns of colors with each turn.
